intro: Epidendrum × elongatum subsp. rubrum, commonly known as the red-flowered epidendrum, is a hybrid orchid species native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange-red flowers, which are often adorned with contrasting yellow or green markings. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain.
